alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:27PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northeastern Livingston, Tangipahoa, Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and northwestern Pearl River Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 227 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sandy Hook to near Independence. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Bogalusa, Covington, Franklinton, Poplarville, Amite, Ponchatoula, Amite City, Abita Springs, Independence, Varnado, Roseland, Albany, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Sun, Montpelier, Enon and Crossroads. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 32 and 61. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 20 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM CDT for southern Mississippi. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. Helena; Washington
